titles: An elegy, on the most lamented of princes King Charles the Second, our late sovereign of ever blessed memory.
notes: Verse: "If sorrow's all we pay a heaven-crown'd head ..."
Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  II, --  King of England, 1630-1685 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
